Deficiency Narrative: 2 of 4 youth preliminary service plans were completed past the 72 hour requirement.

08/22/2023-The operation's LCCA submitted to licensing the operation's Corrective Action Plan indicating the two 72-Hour Preliminary Service Plans had two different dates in two different fields; however, Extended Reach has been updated as related to the field to show placement date and auto populate completed.  LCCA signed the Corrective Action Plan on 08/22/2023.

LCCA will ensure that the correct date is on the plan as well as the date of placement is on the plan as well.  

Additionally, LCCA submitted a revised copy of the operation's 72-Hour Preliminary Service Plan.

Deficiency Narrative:
2 of 3 non-emergency discharge summaries were observed to have provided 2 days advance notice of planned discharge. 
There was no documented justification for not meeting the 4 days notice requirement.
Correction Narrative:
08/22/2023-The operation's LCCA submitted licensing the operation's Corrective Action Plan indicating youth are notified of discharge as soon as the operation know the decision is accepted no later than four days of discharge date.  The LCCA indicated this has been added to the Discharge Summary.  According to the LCCA, if a decision has been made not to notify the youth less than four days the Treatment Director will approve.  The LCCA signed as well as dated the Corrective Action Plan on 08/22/2023.

The LCCA provided licensing a copy of the operation's revised Discharge Summary.

Deficiency Narrative: 3 of 3 discharge summaries evaluated were observed to be missing information as required by 748.1439(b)(1)(A-F).

Deficiency Narrative: Based on information gathered during an evaluation of two volunteer records, it was determined two out two volunteer records reviewed did not contain a statement signed and dated by the volunteer indicating the volunteer must immediately report any suspected incident of abuse, neglect, or exploitation to the Texas Abuse and Neglect Hotline and the operationÂ’s administrator.

Additionally, the LCCA attempted to contact the other volunteer via email as well as by telephone in efforts for the volunteer to sign as well as submit the Report Abuse and Neglect Statement; however, was unsuccessful in contacting the volunteer.  The LCCA demonstrated an attempt in meeting compliance requirements.

The operation is creating a new Abuse and Neglect Statement form for the use with volunteers meeting compliance.

04/14/2023- The LCCA contacted licensing staff via email stating both volunteers were removed from the background system as of 04/13/2023.

Deficiency Narrative: Three of the three child files did not have the PLSP signatures on the Admission Assessment/Preliminary Service Plan.

Deficiency Narrative: One out of the three child  files reviewed showed an admission assessment that was missing information. There were a few pages that were blank with no entered information.
Correction Narrative: In extended reach we have set due dates in the system to flag when a document is due or if it is incomplete. With the new settings the treatment director will automatically be notified on the date of arrival that the plan is due then another reminder if incomplete next day. The Program Administrator will also receive the same reminder to ensure that oversight of completion of documents does not occur. Admission Assessment will be completed prior to arrival on all youth or upon arrival to facility.

Deficiency Narrative: One child's  medication logs  documentation reviewed for the month of December of 2021 showed the child was not administered one of the required  prescribed medications two times.
Correction Narrative: An email was sent to rccr staff on 01/13/2022 stating Aspire 2 Dream administrator has held a meeting with all Staff to go over the medication log and the additional information section. It also states that the agency Staff have been notified to always document any error or give explanation on any medication not given.  An email was sent on 01/20/2022 with the staff sign-in sheet from the staff meeting conducted with the staff regarding medication errors conducted on 12/27/2021.

Deficiency Narrative: One child's  medication log documentation reviewed showed the child was not administered one of the required  prescribed medications two times in the month of December 2021.  The medication error was not documented.
Correction Narrative: An email was sent to rccr staff on 01/13/2022 stating the medication error was related to the pharmacy not having the medication available, and the administrative staff has spoken with Superior concerning the medication and was advised that the emergency line can be utilized and assistance is available with 1-3 days meds in event this ever happens again.

Deficiency Narrative: Two employees resigned approximately one month ago and the two staff still has active background checks.
Correction Narrative: BGC invalidation verified for the 2 former staff. An email was sent to rccr staff on 01/13/2022 stating Aspire 2 Dream will ensure that any employee no longer affiliated with the organization will be inactive in the background system within 7 days of departure. A2D has added a checklist to ensure that this is apart of the exit process for all Staff.

Deficiency Narrative: The follow-up inspection conducted at the operation. the wardrobe in the front bedroom has been dismantled and removed from bedroom, and is located on the front porch away from the front door. One bedroom door is damaged and does not close, which does not allow for privacy. Another bedroom door is warped and separating. The two holes in the walls have been covered with plastic door protector. One set of blinds was observed to have broken slats.
Correction Narrative: Executive Director submitted photos and video footage of doors replaced and/or repaired, new blinds installed, and old wardrobe closet removed. All repairs have been completed.

Deficiency Narrative: A child complained of pain and was asked to be taken to the doctor by the staff after being punched approximately 10 times in the back of head by another child during an incident at the facility. The child was not taken to the doctor.
Correction Narrative:
Anytime a child complains of illness or pain, we will seek medical attention for that child. Staff will contact administrator and administrator will assess injury and provide the immediate medical attention needed.
If a child complains of an illness that is not an emergency, we are able to call Teladoc at 1-800-835-2362. This is a 24/7 access to a doctor by phone or video.
If there is an urgent need for medical attention, the child will be taken to urgent care facility to be examined.
In the event of an extreme emergency, we will call 911 or take the child to the nearest emergency room.

Deficiency Narrative: Based on interviews conducted and records reviewed, it was determined the unauthorized absence debriefing for the 2 youth was not conducted timely.
Correction Narrative: An email was sent to rccr on 01/22/2022 stating the operation will conduct a befriefing within 24 hours of a child returning and send a copy to the rccr to ensure that the information is appropriately documented with the date and time stamped.

Deficiency Narrative:
A review of the treatment plans of the 2 youth who ran away from the facility identified significant required information missing. 
One youth's service plan review was overdue and had not been completed. 
One youth's service plan review did not describe the trauma history or known triggers; identified the youth as a victim of or at risk of being victim of human trafficking, however, did not identify high risk behaviors or plans to address any; did not identify any progress/efforts made by the provider towards achieving the permanency goal; did not address transitioning to successful adulthood or life skills strengths/challenges; and describes that the youth receives 24/7 supervision.
Correction Narrative: An email was sent to rccr staff on 01/21/2022 stating:Aspire 2 Dream Executive Director has assumed the role of LCCA and has been working closely with the Treatment Director ensure understanding of role of Treatment Director. We also contracted with a experienced Treatment Director to do a training with Treatment Director and to review the CPOS. The 2 youth in question are no longer in care at Aspire 2 Dream. All future plans will be updated by Treatment Director using information she obtain from working with the kids, psychological reports, cans, and therapy notes. The treatment team will participate in all plans with notification to dfps caseworker to join the review.

Deficiency Narrative: Based on interviews conducted and records reviewed, it was determined a caregiver who was in ratio, was pulled away from the group of children to the hallway by the treatment director to discuss a youth, allowing 2 youth the opportunity to runaway from the operation. At the time of the unauthorized absence of the 2 youth, there were 6 children in care (5 treatment services) with 2 caregivers assigned to ratio, as well as the office manager and administrator who were both engaged in administrative duties (not counted in ratio). The youth remained gone until the following day.
Correction Narrative: An email was sent to rccr staff on 01/21/2022 stating the operation will ensure that adequate staff are scheduled for each group of youth that are not engaged in administrative duties. The email states the schedule will reflect if an administrative is counted in ratio within the timeframe.

Deficiency Narrative: During an inspection a wardrobe cabinet was observed to be severly damaged. Thier was blinds in one of the bedrooms that were observed to be damaged. Their were 2 holes observed in 2 different child's bedroom walls and one of the bedroom doors would not close where the hole was present.

Based on information obtained in interviews and records reviewed, it was founded that there were seven children in care  at the operation, all of which were located in the t.v. room and two direct care staff present at the operation, both staff  were putting away the children's medications located in the hallway of the facility. While both direct care staff were in the hallway, a fight started between two youth in the t.v. room where the children were located. Based on the layout of the facility the t.v. room can not be seen while a person is in the hallway and there is also a door located in the t.v. room.
Correction Narrative: An email was sent to rccr staff on 01/13/2022 stating Aspire 2 Dream staff has been reorientated about the supervision requirements and will ensure that children are monitored at all times. The email also states Staff will ensure that they will not put themselves in the position where they canÂ’t see or hear children to ensure the children are safe and they are able to quickly respond to any situation.

Deficiency Narrative: Based on information obtained in interviews and records reviewed, there was only one staff on shift during the weekday mornings with 7 children in care, 6 of which were treatment services children.
Correction Narrative: An email was sent to rccr staff on 01/13/2022 stating Aspire 2 Dream administrator have corrected scheduling to ensure adequate staffing. The email also states Staff has access to time app with updated scheduling information and a copy of the schedule is printed at the home.

Deficiency Narrative: A direct care staff with a hire date of 8/2/21, does not have an active background check.

The review plan did not include information from the recent psychological completed, did not include trauma history and triggers, did not include therapy information, nor any progress summary. Correction Narrative:
11/29/21-LCCA Nikki Relford submitted corrective plans: This child is no longer in care at A2D however all future childÂ’s service plan will document any high risk behaviors of self harm with plans to address them documented. All recent psychological, cans report, weekly therapy notes and treatment director notes will be utilized when creating plans. Plans will also
include any efforts for transition. Also, Treatment Director and LCCA will work together with entire treatment team to collect all updated data to include in plans. A PLSP will be identified at later date.

Deficiency Narrative: Youth are being subjected to random drug testing conducted at the operation by the operation staff.

standard/rule. As of 12/10/21, LCCA has not submitted an AR request.
